Issues.Title: Pull release/6.0 into main
Issues.Body:
Contains #5453 and #5329
Fixes #5448
Fixes #4119

## Description
I recently noticed that a couple of changes were made in `release/6.0` and were never pulled back into `main` so I took the liberty of opening a PR targeting `main` with those changes.

I did this by rebasing and squashing `release/6.0` onto `main` and then I removed changes that were specific to `release/6.0`.

## Customer Impact
None.

## Regression
No.

## Testing
Local build + this code is already in `release/6.0`.

## Risk
None.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Pull release/6.0 into main" (#6071)

Issues.Title: Editing for DataGrid cell is not triggered while pressing any characters for some language
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Editing-for-DataGrid-cell-is-not-trigger/1651231)._ --- In WPF DataGrid, if we select a cell and press any key, editing for that cell is triggered properly when the selected language in language preferences option in Windows 10 is English. If we select Tamil, then the cell doesn't enter edit mode when pressing any character in the key. Please refer to the attached video illustration of the problem and provide if there is any way to resolve this. [DataGrid_EditDemo.zip] (https://aka.ms/dc/file?name=B0dce2072831744a2966a813180c0bcdd637792309689738136_DataGrid_EditDemo.zip&tid=0dce2072831744a2966a813180c0bcdd637792309689738136) --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 2/2/2022, 05:33 PM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Editing for DataGrid cell is not triggered while pressing any characters for some language" (#6070)

Issues.Title: show immediately when replacing current tooltip (#6058)
Issues.Body:
Fixes #5703

## Description

Moving the mouse from a control A that is showing a tooltip, to another control B that has a tooltip, should show B's tooltip immediately (ignoring its InitialShowDelay). This works correctly if A's tooltip is closed before checking whether B has a tooltip, which was always the case prior to .NET 6.0. The new tooltip behavior in 6.0 can keep A's tooltip open longer, and now needs to check whether a tooltip is already open when it decides that B wants to open its tooltip.

There's an ambiguous case when moving the mouse toward A's tooltip and passing over B.  If the user intends to move to A's tooltip (e.g. to read the tooltip with Magnifier), the tooltip should stay open;  but if the user intends to move to B, the tooltip should close and be immediately replaced by B's tooltip.  We can't know the user's intent.  Instead we delay replacing the tooltip long enough to detect steady motion toward A's tooltip, but short enough to open B's tooltip "immediately" if the user stops moving the mouse.

## Customer Impact

Fixes a regression.

## Regression

<!-- Is this fixing a problem that was introduced in the most recent release, ie., fixing a regression? -->
Yes

## Testing

<!-- What kind of testing has been done with the fix. -->

## Risk

Low. Handles a case that couldn't happen in .NET 5.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "show immediately when replacing current tooltip (#6058)" (#6064)

Issues.Title: show immediately when replacing current tooltip
Issues.Body:
Fixes #5703

## Description

Moving the mouse from a control A that is showing a tooltip, to another control B that has a tooltip, should show B's tooltip immediately (ignoring its InitialShowDelay). This works correctly if A's tooltip is closed before checking whether B has a tooltip, which was always the case prior to .NET 6.0. The new tooltip behavior in 6.0 can keep A's tooltip open longer, and now needs to check whether a tooltip is already open when it decides that B wants to open its tooltip.

There's an ambiguous case when moving the mouse toward A's tooltip and passing over B.  If the user intends to move to A's tooltip (e.g. to read the tooltip with Magnifier), the tooltip should stay open;  but if the user intends to move to B, the tooltip should close and be immediately replaced by B's tooltip.  We can't know the user's intent.  Instead we delay replacing the tooltip long enough to detect steady motion toward A's tooltip, but short enough to open B's tooltip "immediately" if the user stops moving the mouse.

## Customer Impact

Fixes a regression.

## Regression

<!-- Is this fixing a problem that was introduced in the most recent release, ie., fixing a regression? -->
Yes

## Testing

<!-- What kind of testing has been done with the fix. -->

## Risk

Low. Handles a case that couldn't happen in .NET 5.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "show immediately when replacing current tooltip" (#6058)

Issues.Title: ToolTips in popups (or any context where capture is active) (#5931)
Issues.Body:
Fixes #5716

## Description

The new 6.0 tooltip behavior computes a "safe area" in which the user can move the mouse without dismissing the tooltip.  It's computed with coordinates relative to the owner's PresentationSource (hwnd), but the mouse movements were tracked relative to the input provider's PresentationSource.  These are often the same, but not when the tooltip's owner comes from a Popup (or similar context that captures mouse input away from the normal input provider).  This dismisses the tooltip immediately - the logic thinks the mouse has left the safe area.

Fixed by converting the mouse position to the correct coordinate system - relative to the tooltip owner's PresentationSource.

## Customer Impact

<!-- What is the impact to customers of not taking this fix? -->
Fixes a regression.

## Regression

<!-- Is this fixing a problem that was introduced in the most recent release, ie., fixing a regression? -->
Yes.

## Testing

<!-- What kind of testing has been done with the fix. -->

## Risk

<!-- Please assess the risk of taking this fix. Provide details backing up your assessment. -->
Low.  Applies the correct coordinate transformation before checking the mouse position.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ToolTips in popups (or any context where capture is active) (#5931)" (#6063)

Issues.Title: Port dirty-rectangle opt-out from 4.8 (#5837)
Issues.Body:
Addresses #5441
This is a port of a servicing fix in .NET 4.7-4.8.

## Description

The problem is due to a limitation of D3D - the content it presents via dirty-rectangles can be out of sync with the rest of the content, if the timing of the presents and fills is unfortunate.  WPF cannot fix this, but we can mitigate it by giving the app a way to disable the dirty-rectangle optimization.  This impacts the graphics performance;  by opting-in the app accepts the tradeoff of performance vs. fidelity.

The mitigation takes the form of two AppContext switches:
* Switch.System.Windows.Media.MediaContext.DisableDirtyRectangles
* Switch.System.Windows.Media.MediaContext.EnableDynamicDirtyRectangles

These can be set using one of the techniques listed [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.appcontext?view=net-5.0#remarks) under the subheading "AppContext for library consumers".   Setting the first switch to 'true' disables the dirty-rectangle optimization.  Setting the second switch to 'true' causes WPF to re-query the first switch before each render, so that it honors changes the app makes at runtime by calling AppContext.SetSwitch.

## Customer Impact

<!-- What is the impact to customers of not taking this fix? -->
No way to get rapidly updating images to display faithfully.

## Regression

<!-- Is this fixing a problem that was introduced in the most recent release, ie., fixing a regression? -->
No

## Testing

Ad-hoc around customer scenario.
Standard regression testing.

## Risk

Low. Port of a .NETFx servicing fix released earlier this year.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Port dirty-rectangle opt-out from 4.8 (#5837)" (#6062)

Setting the first switch to 'true' disables the dirty-rectangle optimization. Issues.Title: Replace resource constants with properties in WindowsBase
Issues.Body:
Contributes to dotnet/wpf#1

Depends on #6059

## Description
Replace the use of resource constants with properties in WindowsBase. This follows the standard of other .Net projects, like [dotnet/runtime](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime).

There are a bunch of files that are shared with other projects. I temporarily changed the use of constants with using nameof of properties in WindowsBase in this commit: 86ef9fc8510ca3c787116a45509cc902a7687b5d.

## Customer Impact
None.

## Regression
No.

## Testing
I tested a few resources and made sure that the generated code in the property getter is the same as the original code.

## Risk
None.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Replace resource constants with properties in WindowsBase" (#6060)

Issues.Title: Prerequisite for replacing resource constants with properties
Issues.Body:
Contributes to dotnet/wpf#1

## Description
This PR does not change anything about the current build. This PR helps my future PRs on using properties instead of constants for resources. It lowers the conflicts that can occur with multiple PRs because we only need to set `_GenerateResourcesCodeAsConstants` for each projects to enable using properties instead of constants ([Example](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/6053)).

The changes in SystemResources.props are temporary because once every project use properties instead of constants, `GenerateResxSourceOmitGetResourceString` will always be true and `GenerateResourcesCodeAsConstants`  will always be false.

## Customer Impact
None.

## Regression
No.

## Testing
Local build + CI.

## Risk
None.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Prerequisite for replacing resource constants with properties" (#6059)

Issues.Title: WPF DataGrid column width can be changed using the keyboard shortcut ALT+left or right arrow key
Issues.Body:
Fixes # <!-- Issue Number --> #5880 

Main PR <!-- Link to PR if any that fixed this in the main branch. --> #6054 

## Description

<!-- Give a brief summary of the issue and how the pull request is fixing it. -->
Issue related to WPF DataGrid column width can now be changed using the keyboard shortcut "ALT + left arrow key" and "ALT + right arrow key".

## Customer Impact

<!-- What is the impact to customers of not taking this fix? -->
Fixes a regression.

## Regression

<!-- Is this fixing a problem that was introduced in the most recent release, ie., fixing a regression? -->
Yes.

## Testing

<!-- What kind of testing has been done with the fix. -->
Integration tests are in progress.

## Risk

<!-- Please assess the risk of taking this fix. Provide details backing up your assessment. -->
Low. Add ability to adjust column width using keyboard for WPF DataGrid.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "WPF DataGrid column width can be changed using the keyboard shortcut ALT+left or right arrow key" (#6054)

Issues.Title: Replace resource constants with properties in WindowsFormsIntegration
Issues.Body:
Contributes to dotnet/wpf#1

Depends on #6059

## Description
Replace the use of resource constants with properties in WindowsFormsIntegration. This follows the standard of other .Net projects, like [dotnet/runtime](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime).

## Customer Impact
None.

## Regression
No.

## Testing
I tested a few resources and made sure that the generated code in the property getter is the same as the original code.

## Risk
None.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Replace resource constants with properties in WindowsFormsIntegration" (#6053)

Issues.Title: Community Survey
Issues.Body:
A few years ago, we polled community members in this repository to see how we were doing as maintainers. 

It's time to repeat the same investigation now, to gather valuable insights and become better at doing this.
 
Tell us about your experience in participating in and contributing to the project, whether you have been around for years or are new.  

We request you to complete the below survey, it'll take a few minutes and you can reply to up to 3 repositories: 
 
https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/8QTQTGJ?Source=wpf
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Community Survey" (#6052)

Issues.Title: ToolTips in popups (or any context where capture is active) (#5931)
Issues.Body:
Fixes #5716

### Description
The new 6.0 tooltip behavior computes a "safe area" in which the user can move the mouse without dismissing the tooltip. It's computed with coordinates relative to the owner's PresentationSource (hwnd), but the mouse movements were tracked relative to the input provider's PresentationSource. These are often the same, but not when the tooltip's owner comes from a Popup (or similar context that captures mouse input away from the normal input provider). This dismisses the tooltip immediately - the logic thinks the mouse has left the safe area.

Fixed by converting the mouse position to the correct coordinate system - relative to the tooltip owner's PresentationSource.

### Customer Impact
Fixes a regression.

### Regression
Yes.

### Testing
### Risk
Low. Applies the correct coordinate transformation before checking the mouse position.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ToolTips in popups (or any context where capture is active) (#5931)" (#6045)

Issues.Title: Use generic Marshal.StructureToPtr
Issues.Body:
## Description
Use generic Marshal.StructureToPtr instead of the non-generic. I removed the customs UnsafeNativeMethods.StructureToPtr which justs forwards to Marshal.StructureToPtr because it causes linker warnings because Marshal.StructureToPtr is annotated while UnsafeNativeMethods.StructureToPtr isn't.

Almost every call to Marshal.StructureToPtr were already using the generic overload without the need to change the code.

Contributes to #3811

## Customer Impact
None, same behavior as the non-generic.

## Regression
No

## Testing
I manually tested a few of the generic and non-generic and they gave the same result.

## Risk
None, same behavior as the non-generic.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use generic Marshal.StructureToPtr" (#6044)

Issues.Title: . NET6 WPF: ToolTip doesn't work on ComboBoxItem
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/NET6-WPF:-ToolTip-doesnt-work-on-Combo/1648606)._ --- [severity:It bothers me. A fix would be nice] In WPF of .NET 6, the tooltip of the ComboBoxItem doesn't work if the ComboBox is inside of a UserControl. Actual behavior: the tooltip shows up for about 500ms and then it disappears. Expected behavior: the tooltip gets displayed for a reasonable amount of time. Note: _Setting explicitly the 'ToolTipService.ShowDuration' doesn't help._ Environment: Visual Studio Professional 2022 64-bit 17.0.5, .NET 6.0.1, Windows 10 Pro Version:21H1 I enclosed a project file that shows the issue: [TooTipTest.zip] (https://aka.ms/dc/file?name=B054640530ce04d1181db74af20165109637788677425623620_TooTipTest.zip&tid=054640530ce04d1181db74af20165109637788677425623620) I also inline the XAML for clarity. The UserControl that contains the ComboBox: ``` ``` The Windows that hosts the UserControl: ``` ``` --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 1/27/2022, 00:45 AM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ". NET6 WPF: ToolTip doesn't work on ComboBoxItem" (#6043)

Issues.Title: Editing for DataGrid cell is not triggered while pressing any characters in keyboard only for some set of languages
Issues.Body:
In WPF DataGrid, if we select a cell and press any key, editing for that cell is triggered properly when the selected language in language preferences option in Windows 10 is English. 

If we select Tamil, then the cell doesn't enter edit mode when pressing any character in the key. 

Please refer to the attached video illustration of the problem and provide if there is any way to resolve this.


[DataGrid_EditDemo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/7970881/DataGrid_EditDemo.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Editing for DataGrid cell is not triggered while pressing any characters in keyboard only for some set of languages" (#6041)
